intro: Ochrocarpos longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved ochrocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
